p: CET and its derived ester compounds (such as HT and HHT) have all been found to possess activity against leukemic cells [ 16, 18]. The anti-tumor ability of these compounds is believed to arise from their inhibitory effects on protein synthesis [ 27]. Previous research also determined that CET and its ester derivatives have inhibitory effects against HBV [ 16], VZV and CHIKV [ 19, 21]. However, this is the first study to demonstrate that CET inhibits ZIKV infection. Specifically, results of IFA revealed that CET treatment reduced viral infection in both Vero and A549 cells ( Fig. 1).
